content: foxash square by jacqui goulbourn difficulty level intermediate terminology us terms skills required front post and back post stitches popcorn and jacobs ladder yarn any weight of yarn according to the required size of the finished square the sample is shown in stylecraft special dk hook size to achieve gauge size 12 inch square in worsted weight yarn 8 5 inches in dk weight introduction foxash is a place that only properly exists in the past it was one of the land settlement association s horticultural sites from the 1930 s until the 1980 s initially to help with post ww1 unemployment the sites became important food producers during ww2 some greenhouses and horticultural activity still exist in the area in north essex colours used stylecraft special dk in silver grey charcoal wisteria and violet abbreviations bpdc back post double_crochet popcorn 5 double_crochet popcorn work 5 double_crochet in same st remove hook insert hook through top of 1st double_crochet and pull working loop through chain chain stitch round s round s chain-space chain space single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet skip skip fpdc front post double_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch fptr front post treble_crochet space s space s half_double_crochet half_double_crochet st s stitch es repeat s repeat s treble_crochet treble_crochet blo back loop only flo front loop only find more of my designs at www catkitbob com www ravelry com/designers/jacqui-goulbourn https //payhip com/catkitbobdesigns catkitbob designs november 2021 page �1 of �6 foxash square instructions notes - the 1st double_crochet of each round can be worked either as chain 3 or standing double_crochet for 1st half_double_crochet chain 2 or standing half_double_crochet this also applies when starting a round with a popcorn - finish each round by joining to the top of the first st of the round - colour changes are indicated in 2nd column there are not specific instructions to finish off each colour - depending on your gauge some rounds may not lie flat but later rounds will correct this - charts are below the written instructions photos at end rrnndd col instructions shape total our at end stitches of round set a chain 4 join with slip_stitch to form a ring or work magic_ring up 1 a 8 single_crochet in ring circle 8 single_crochet 2 a 2 double_crochet in each st around circle 16 double_crochet 3 a in flo *single_crochet chain 2* repeat from * to * 15 more times circle 16 single_crochet 16 chain- space 4 b in blo of round 2 *2 double_crochet in next st double_crochet in following st* repeat from * to * 7 circle 24 double_crochet more times 5 b *double_crochet in next 2 sts 2 double_crochet in following st* repeat from * to * 7 more times circle 32 double_crochet 6 a join to a st that is before one that is above a round 3 chain-space *single_crochet treble_crochet in circle 16 single_crochet 16 treble_crochet round 3 chain-space skip 1* repeat from * to * 15 more times 7 c join to any single_crochet *double_crochet in
